snippet: The former leading mobile phone maker in Japan had watched its share of the domestic market dwindle to 5.3 percent, down from 28 percent in 2001.
abstract: NEC, once leading cellphone maker in Japan, says it will quit making smartphones; company watched its share of domestic market dwindle to 5.3 percent, down from 28 percent in 2001.
lead_paragraph: The former leading mobile phone maker in Japan had watched its share of the domestic market dwindle to 5.3 percent, down from 28 percent in 2001.

headline.main: NEC of Japan Is Exiting Market for Smartphones
headline.print_headline: NEC of Japan Is Exiting Market for Smartphones
